title: SSH to linux server with ssh key not password
content:
I always create new linux servers for deploying our applications and due to this I don’t want to remember all these password so I use a ssh key and push the publish key to the vps and use my private key to authenticate

ssh-copy-id -i $HOME/.ssh/id_rsa.pub root@xx.xx.xx.xx
=> then you will asked to enter the root password
=> then you can login direct using ssh root@xx.xx.xx.xx

It is also used when trying to open ssh session between nodes like VMs nodes.
